Structs/MessageHandler.html#/s:8SwiftRex.name: actionHandler
Structs/MessageHandler.html#/s:8SwiftRex.abstract: A way for Middlewares to trigger new actions.

Structs/MessageHandler.html#/s:8SwiftRex.name: eventHandler
Structs/MessageHandler.html#/s:8SwiftRex.abstract: A way for Middlewares to dispatch new events.

Structs/MessageHandler.html.name: MessageHandler
Structs/MessageHandler.html.abstract: MessageHandler is a data structure that wraps an EventHandler and a ActionHandler, offering a way to dispatch events (EventProtocol) and trigger actions (ActionProtocol). This is usually the way how Middlewares will communicate both, actions and events, to Stores that will re-distribute them through its pipelines.

Closure type-aliases.html#/s:8SwiftRex8G.name: GetState
Closure type-aliases.html#/s:8SwiftRex8G.abstract: Zero-argument function that returns the current state.

Closure type-aliases.html#/s:8SwiftRex17.name: NextActionHandler
Closure type-aliases.html#/s:8SwiftRex17.abstract: A function that calls the next action handler in the chain.

Closure type-aliases.html#/s:8SwiftRex16.name: NextEventHandler
Closure type-aliases.html#/s:8SwiftRex16.abstract: A function that calls the next event handler in the chain.

Closure type-aliases.html#/s:8SwiftRex14.name: ReduceFunction
Closure type-aliases.html#/s:8SwiftRex14.abstract: State reducer: takes current state and an action, computes the new state.

Protocols/Monoid.html#/s:8SwiftRex6Monoi.name: empty
Protocols/Monoid.html#/s:8SwiftRex6Monoi.abstract: Neutral monoidal container. Composing any monoid with an empty monoid should result in a function unchanged, regardless if the empty element is on the left-hand side or the right-hand side.

Protocols/Monoid.html.name: Monoid
Protocols/Monoid.html.abstract: Protocol for a monoid container, allowing monoidal composition

Classes/SubstateMiddleware.html#/s:8Swif.name: handlers
Classes/SubstateMiddleware.html#/s:8Swif.abstract: A Middleware is capable of triggering ActionProtocol to the Store. This property is a nullable ActionHandler used for the middleware to trigger the actions. It’s gonna be injected by the Store or by a parent Middleware, so don’t worry about it, just use it whenever you need to trigger something.

Classes/SubstateMiddleware.html#/s:8Swif.name: handle(event:getState:next:)
Classes/SubstateMiddleware.html#/s:8Swif.abstract: Handles the incoming events and may trigger side-effects, may trigger actions, may start an asynchronous operation.

Classes/SubstateMiddleware.html#/s:8Swif.name: handle(action:getState:next:)
Classes/SubstateMiddleware.html#/s:8Swif.abstract: Handles the incoming actions and may change them or trigger additional ones. Usually this is not the best place to start side-effects or trigger new actions, it should be more as an observation point for tracking, logging and telemetry.

Classes/ComposedMiddleware.html#/s:8Swif.name: init()
Classes/ComposedMiddleware.html#/s:8Swif.abstract: Default initializer for ComposedMiddleware, use this only if you don’t like custom operators, otherwise create a ComposedMiddleware by composing two or more middlewares using the diamond operator, as shown below:

Classes/ComposedMiddleware.html#/s:8Swif.name: handlers
Classes/ComposedMiddleware.html#/s:8Swif.abstract: A Middleware is capable of triggering ActionProtocol to the Store. This property is a nullable ActionHandler used for the middleware to trigger the actions. It’s gonna be injected by the Store or by a parent Middleware, so don’t worry about it, just use it whenever you need to trigger something.

Classes/ComposedMiddleware.html#/s:8Swif.name: append(middleware:)
Classes/ComposedMiddleware.html#/s:8Swif.abstract: Appends a new middleware to end of the composition (inner chain). Use this only if you don’t like custom operators, otherwise create a ComposedMiddleware append more middlewares to the composition by using the diamond operator, as shown below:

Classes/ComposedMiddleware.html#/s:8Swif.name: handle(event:getState:next:)
Classes/ComposedMiddleware.html#/s:8Swif.abstract: Handles the incoming events. The ComposedMiddleware will call handle(event:getState:next:) for all its internal middlewares, in the order as they were composed and when all of them are done, the EventProtocol will be forwarded to the next middleware in the chain.

Classes/ComposedMiddleware.html#/s:8Swif.name: handle(action:getState:next:)
Classes/ComposedMiddleware.html#/s:8Swif.abstract: Handles the incoming actions. The ComposedMiddleware will call handle(action:getState:next:) for all its internal middlewares, in the order as they were composed and when all of them are done, the ActionProtocol will be forwarded to the next middleware in the chain.

Classes/DirectLineMiddleware.html#/s:8Sw.name: handlers
Classes/DirectLineMiddleware.html#/s:8Sw.abstract: A Middleware is capable of triggering ActionProtocol to the Store. This property is a nullable ActionHandler used for the middleware to trigger the actions. It’s gonna be injected by the Store or by a parent Middleware, so don’t worry about it, just use it whenever you need to trigger something.

Classes/DirectLineMiddleware.html#/s:8Sw.name: handle(event:getState:next:)
Classes/DirectLineMiddleware.html#/s:8Sw.abstract: Handles the incoming events. The DirectLineMiddleware is a useful tool when you have a very simple EventProtocol that is also an ActionProtocol and no decision has to be made other than forwarding the event as it is to the action queue.

Classes/DirectLineMiddleware.html#/s:8Sw.name: handle(action:getState:next:)
Classes/DirectLineMiddleware.html#/s:8Sw.abstract: Handles the incoming actions. The DirectLineMiddleware won’t do anything with the ActionProtocol, simply forwards it to the next middleware in the chain.

Classes/BypassMiddleware.html#/s:8SwiftR.name: handlers
Classes/BypassMiddleware.html#/s:8SwiftR.abstract: A Middleware is capable of triggering ActionProtocol to the Store. This property is a nullable ActionHandler used for the middleware to trigger the actions. It’s gonna be injected by the Store or by a parent Middleware, so don’t worry about it, just use it whenever you need to trigger something.

Classes/BypassMiddleware.html#/s:8SwiftR.name: handle(event:getState:next:)
Classes/BypassMiddleware.html#/s:8SwiftR.abstract: Handles the incoming events. The BypassMiddleware won’t do anything with the EventProtocol, simply forwards it to the next middleware in the chain.

Classes/BypassMiddleware.html#/s:8SwiftR.name: handle(action:getState:next:)
Classes/BypassMiddleware.html#/s:8SwiftR.abstract: Handles the incoming actions. The BypassMiddleware won’t do anything with the ActionProtocol, simply forwards it to the next middleware in the chain.

Protocols/Middleware.html#/s:8SwiftRex10.name: StateType
Protocols/Middleware.html#/s:8SwiftRex10.abstract: The State that this Middleware knowns how to handle. Thanks to lenses, this state can be a sub-state lifted to a global state. Please check lift(_:) for more details.

Protocols/Middleware.html#/s:8SwiftRex10.name: handlers
Protocols/Middleware.html#/s:8SwiftRex10.abstract: A Middleware is capable of triggering ActionProtocol to the Store. This property is a nullable ActionHandler used for the middleware to trigger the actions. It’s gonna be injected by the Store or by a parent Middleware, so don’t worry about it, just use it whenever you need to trigger something.

Protocols/Middleware.html#/s:8SwiftRex10.name: handle(event:getState:next:)
Protocols/Middleware.html#/s:8SwiftRex10.abstract: Handles the incoming events and may trigger side-effects, may trigger actions, may start an asynchronous operation.

Protocols/Middleware.html#/s:8SwiftRex10.name: handle(action:getState:next:)
Protocols/Middleware.html#/s:8SwiftRex10.abstract: Handles the incoming actions and may change them or trigger additional ones. Usually this is not the best place to start side-effects or trigger new actions, it should be more as an observation point for tracking, logging and telemetry.

Protocols/Middleware.html#/s:8SwiftRex10.name: lift(_:)
Protocols/Middleware.html#/s:8SwiftRex10.abstract: A lenses method. The global state of your app is Whole, and the Middleware handles Part, that is a sub-state.

Protocols/Middleware.html.name: Middleware
Protocols/Middleware.html.abstract: ‚õì Middleware is a plugin, or a composition of several plugins, that are assigned to the Store pipeline in order to handle each EventProtocol dispatched and to create ActionProtocol in response. It’s also capable of handling each ActionProtocol before the Reducer to do its job.

Classes/BypassMiddleware.html.name: BypassMiddleware
Classes/BypassMiddleware.html.abstract: The BypassMiddleware won’t do any operation to either, EventProtocol and ActionProtocol, it will simply forward them to the next middleware in the chain. It can be useful for Unit Tests or for some compositions.

Classes/DirectLineMiddleware.html.name: DirectLineMiddleware
Classes/DirectLineMiddleware.html.abstract: The DirectLineMiddleware is a useful tool when you have a very simple EventProtocol that is also an ActionProtocol and no decision has to be made other than forwarding the event as it is to the action queue.

Classes/ComposedMiddleware.html.name: ComposedMiddleware
Classes/ComposedMiddleware.html.abstract: The ComposedMiddleware is a container of inner middlewares that are chained together in the order as they were composed. Whenever an EventProtocol or an ActionProtocol arrives to be handled by this ComposedMiddleware, it will delegate to its internal chain of middlewares.

Middleware (basics).html#/s:8SwiftRex2lg.abstract: Initializes a ComposedMiddleware from the lhs and rhs middlewares parameters, or appends to the lhs if it is already a ComposedMiddleware, as shown below:

Classes/SubstateMiddleware.html.name: SubstateMiddleware
Classes/SubstateMiddleware.html.abstract: This is a container that lifts a sub-state middleware to a global state middleware.

Structs/Reducer.html#/s:8SwiftRex7Reduce.name: init(_:)
Structs/Reducer.html#/s:8SwiftRex7Reduce.abstract: Reducer initializer takes only the underlying function (S, A) -> S that is the reducer function itself.

Structs/Reducer.html#/s:8SwiftRex7Reduce.name: empty
Structs/Reducer.html#/s:8SwiftRex7Reduce.abstract: Neutral monoidal container. Composing any monoid with an empty monoid should result in a function unchanged, regardless if the empty element is on the left-hand side or the right-hand side.

Structs/Reducer.html#/s:8SwiftRex7Reduce.name: lift(_:)
Structs/Reducer.html#/s:8SwiftRex7Reduce.abstract: A lenses method. The global state of your app is Whole, and the Reducer handles Part, that is a sub-state.

Structs/Reducer.html.name: Reducer
Structs/Reducer.html.abstract: ‚öô Reducer is a pure function wrapped in a monoid container, that takes current state and an action to calculate the new state.

Reducer.html#/s:8SwiftRex14ActionProtoco.name: ActionProtocol
Reducer.html#/s:8SwiftRex14ActionProtoco.abstract: üèÑ‚Äç ActionProtocol represents an action, usually created by a Middleware in response to an event.

Extensions/ActionHandler.html#/s:8SwiftR.name: trigger(_:)
Extensions/ActionHandler.html#/s:8SwiftR.abstract: A way for a Middleware to trigger their actions, usually in response to events or async operations.

Classes/StoreBase.html#/s:8SwiftRex9Stor.name: init(subject:reducer:middleware:)
Classes/StoreBase.html#/s:8SwiftRex9Stor.abstract: Required initializer that takes all the expected pipelines

Classes/StoreBase.html.name: StoreBase
Classes/StoreBase.html.abstract: üè™ Store defines a protocol for the state store of an app. It must have an input and an output:

Store (basic implementation).html#/s:8Sw.name: ActionHandler
Store (basic implementation).html#/s:8Sw.abstract: ActionHandler is a data structure that wraps a closuse which represents a way to trigger actions - defined by the type ActionProtocol. The entity responsible for receiving and distributing these actions (usually the Store) will offer this closure to the entities that want to trigger new actions (usually the Middlewares).

Extensions/EventHandler.html#/s:8SwiftRe.name: dispatch(_:)
Extensions/EventHandler.html#/s:8SwiftRe.abstract: A way for a ViewController, Presenter, ViewModel or Middleware to dispatch new events.

Protocols/Store.html.name: Store
Protocols/Store.html.abstract: üè™ Store defines a protocol for the state store of an app. It must have an input and an output:

Store (contracts).html#/s:8SwiftRex13Eve.name: EventProtocol
Store (contracts).html#/s:8SwiftRex13Eve.abstract: üïπ EventProtocol represents an event, usually created in response to an user’s input, such as tap, swipe, pinch, scroll.

Store (contracts).html#/s:8SwiftRex12Eve.name: EventHandler
Store (contracts).html#/s:8SwiftRex12Eve.abstract: EventHandler is a data structure that wraps a closure which represents a way to dispatch events - defined by the type EventProtocol. The entity responsible for receiving and distributing these events (usually the Store) will offer this closure to the entities that want to dispatch new events (usually the ViewControllers/Presenter/ViewModels or even Middlewares).

Protocols/StateProvider.html.name: StateProvider
Protocols/StateProvider.html.abstract: StateProvider defines a protocol for an ObservableType of StateType, so everybody can observe the global state changes through this container. Usually a Store.

Other Typealiases.html.name: Other Type Aliases
Other Typealiases.html.abstract: The following type aliases are available globally.
